review_title: Very happy with coworkers and management
pros: Best co-workers ever, best technology in the market in use. The hospital seems to genuinely care about the staff, especially during covid. I have seen some values like outside organizations offering rides for nursing staff, the hospital offering free meals and bonus checks. I would say generous and family like atmosphere. I am leaving out stressful times and requires hard work, and the ability to let harsh words sometimes roll off the back, but its not common. Very thankful for my job and the ability to serve others.
cons: Unsure where things are going. We are stressed and tired and working together. Just unsure of the future with the recent merger. No clear plan relayed to employees, layoffs. Just not sure. Trying to be patient but getting the sense that we are being kept until they are done and will let us go or make us re-apply for a job. Just a gut feeling, I am probably way off wrong.

job_title: Behavior Analysis in New York, NY
pros: Get an opportunity to work first hand with clients with severe intellectual disabilities. They are a joy to work with.
cons: Low salary, has been increased in years. The union is a joke as they have no clout with management. There is no due process on alleged investigations, hence you can lose your job Aust the drop of a hat if someone decides they want to let you go, staff and management alike. The clinical team are there to collect a paycheck add there is no real emphasis on evidence approach bx change. There's little room for growth. I could on and on, but I'll leave it there.

pros: Over the years, I have encountered the most wonderful people, not only who work for me, but also those people working in other areas, as well as those visiting the hospital.  Very friendly environment overall.  People actually care about the job that they are doing.
cons: Top heavy.  Fruitless spending has required downsizing in areas, expect at the top.  Healthcare is expensive, and costs are steadily rising.  However, too many decisions are made by the executives without the input of middle and upper management.  The people that actually drive the ship will probably end up sinking it, unfortunately.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Jackson, MS
pros: Work 3 days a week, self-scheduling, great patients, Nurse managers are available to employees
cons: Getting pulled to work on other floors.  Not being trained to take care of types of patients you don't normally work with.  An example is being pulled to work on the neuro floor and never having an experience with neuro patients.  Being responsible for  12 patients and over half being total care.  Point system for calling in when unable to work.  Not feeling valued and easily disposed of.

pros: The facility had a few good things happening for them such as but not limited to: 3 days a week, offered benefits, great orientation process, great lunches, available parking, advancement opportunity.
cons: There were a few rough spots also. They offered benefits but they were too expensive to obtain at least for my budget. My manager was unfair and rude. Didn't feel support from staff. They impose there religious preferences on what heath concerns they will pay for the employee.

pros: The security staff is nice
cons: This place was very unorganized. The software was out of date.  Honestly,they should come up with a better system to register people . the nurses and other staff look down at you and aren't team players when it comes to getting things done. I feel their making free money because their isn't a certain thing as customer service . you may find a few nice ones but that's about it. My badge never worked to get in and out of places. The machines would always go down and someone from the back would either walk up or meet you with paper work . just imagine 12 people waiting to register and 5 in the waiting area waiting needing to sign ,so after they go sit down they have to get back up.. That's an attitude waiting to happen.

pros: One of the many reasons to work at St Dominic hospital is the wonderful benefits and friendly staff.  Not all places have a good work environment so I'm happy to be working with such a wonderful staff
cons: I really don't have any Con's about the facility. So far I love everything about the facility from location to the experience I'm getting while being employed there

pros: Friendly coworkers, gymn on site
cons:
1.  I have to park at another St. Dominic campus several miles away and take a shuttle bus to and from the main hospital in the morning and afternoon.  If anything comes up during the day I have to arrange a ride out to my car.
2.  Really cramped working environment.

review_title: The experience that I have had at St. Dominic
pros: St. Dominic's hospital is a wonderful place to work. There is an environment that is spiritual that I have not experienced anywhere else and the staff and coworkers are friendly and always there to help when I need it.
cons: I think that there are no cons to working in St. Dominic's hospital. It is a place where people can be taken care of at the same time as getting spiritual care as well.

pros:
Catholic core values
Speaking with Nun's in Hallways
Employee Discount
cons:
Catholic core values not always practiced by upper management
Extrememly profit driven
Revolving door in Human Resources because of low pay; employees always can be replaced
Took Five Times Going Before Hiring Board to be approved as a Full Time Employee
Raise was $.05 cents and Hour
In two years, saw 9 people fired in department - very stressful workplace

review_title: Best hospital to work for in the Jackson area.
pros: Training, culture, relationships to name a few. St. Dominic's has a reputation in the Jackson area that lends them a significant lead in the hospital industry.
cons: There are really no challenges. The sisters are very aware of work life balance and the need to continue pushing the envelope in providing state of the art medical care.

pros: Wonderful coworkers that care about me inside and outside of the hospital. The patients are generally kind and satisfiable. Plenty of shift options.
cons: Understaffed and overcrowded can often lead to unnecessary stressful situations. Miscommunication amongst departments happens from time to time. Packed out hospital floors and/or units leads to holds in the ER overnight on a fairly routine basis.

pros: St Dominic has always been a very friendly, family oriented place
cons: I have always wanted to be a St. Dominic employee for years. I worked in the medical towers for 10 years and have had a blessed opportunity now to become a part of the team

pros: Great place to work. Could be better; working to promote higher employee engagement as well as employee satisfaction could take the experience to a higher level.
cons: Management issues seem to be a subject that little can be done about. Challenges with moving forward are old habits and norms that appear to be engrained in culture.

pros: This hospital works to keep the mission of caring as the central focus.  As with any organization this size, some areas and management are great while others may less than stellar.
cons: Turning into a large organization but hanging on to the old way of doing things.  Needs to move forward to stay a leader in the area.

review_title: Great hospital. Dedicated staff. Sense of family.
pros: Faith-based hospital. Employees support hospital mission of service. Kind, dedicated staff. Fair pay, good benefits. Enjoyed working here very much.
cons: Busy hospital, Fast-paced environment.  Workload gets heavy especially during the winter months. Tightly run financial organization that adheres to budgets which can be a challenge at times.

pros: Best place to work.Easy to approach and friendly personnel.Good feedback from patients that has been there that they get best quality care .
cons: Lost the last time I visited here but the personnel are very approachable and give me the direction to where to go .

pros: Great team, the pay is good but could be a little better, work schedule is flexible, has a good reputation for quality of care
cons: There are too many chiefs and they tend to be competing against one another which makes it hard to get things accomplished if you are lower on the totem pole, communication

pros: St. Dominic's is a good place to work because the people are friendly and helpful. They have some of the best doctors in the state, and it's a Christian based hospital that puts the patients needs first.
cons: I have no cons for working at St. Dominic's hospital.

pros: Christian based facility, that cares about the well being of patients as well as staff. They believe in equal opportunity and set high standards for their employees.
cons: Unable to list anything at this point.

review_title: Exceptional for this field of work and very rewarding
